rows.title: Our Laboratory is the winner of the Russian Megagrant contest
rows.title_rus: Наша Лаборатория стала победителем конкурса Мегагрантов
rows.keywords: Minestry of education, Russia, science, grants, megagrant
rows.keywords_rus: Министерство образования, Россия, наука, гранты, мегагрант
rows.description: Our project of the Laboratory "Tensor networks and deep learning for applications in data mining" (on the basis of the Skolkovo Institute of Science and Technology) under the guidance of prof. Andrzej Cichocki  won the fifth competition for the Russian Federation Government grants for state support in 2017-2019 of scientific research conducted under the supervision of leading scientists at Russian universities and scientific organizations.
rows.description_rus: Проект Лаборатории "Тензорные сети и глубинное обучение для интеллектуального анализа данных" под руководством проф. Анджея Чихоцкого на базе Сколковского института науки и технологий стал победителем пятого конкурса на получение грантов Правительства Российской Федерации для государственной поддержки научных исследований, проводимых под руководством ведущих ученых в российских вузах и научных организациях в 2017-2019 гг.
rows.link1_text: The list of the winners (in Russian)

rows.title: Order on creation of the Laboratory is signed
rows.description: President of the Skolkovo Institute of Science and Technology Alexander Kuleshov signed an order on creation of the Laboratory "Tensor networks and deep learning for applications in data mining"  under the guidance of prof. Andrzej Cichocki. The Laboratory begins to operate from January, 2017.
rows.description_rus: Ректор Сколковского института науки и технологий А.П. Кулешов подписал приказ о создании Лаборатории "Тензорные сети и глубинное обучение для интеллектуального анализа данных" под руководством проф. Анджея Чихоцкого с 1 января 2017 г.

rows.title_medium: New paper: "Improved Texture Networks: Maximizing Quality and Diversity in Feed-forward Stylization and Texture Synthesis"
rows.title_medium_rus: Новая публикация: "Improved Texture Networks: Maximizing Quality and Diversity in Feed-forward Stylization and Texture Synthesis"
rows.title: New paper "Improved Texture Networks: Maximizing Quality and Diversity in Feed-forward Stylization and Texture Synthesis"
rows.title_rus: Новая публикация "Improved Texture Networks: Maximizing Quality and Diversity in Feed-forward Stylization and Texture Synthesis"
rows.description: Victor Lempitsky finilized new publication "Improved Texture Networks: Maximizing Quality and Diversity in Feed-forward Stylization and Texture Synthesis". In this work a list of new algorithms for image stylization problems are developed. The work is performed under MegaGrant support.
rows.description_rus: Виктор Лемпицкий с соавторами опубликовал новую статью "Improved Texture Networks: Maximizing Quality and Diversity in Feed-forward Stylization and Texture Synthesis". В работе предложен ряд новых алгоритмов для эффективной стилизации графических изображений. Работа выполнялась при поддержке МегаГрантом.
rows.description_sub: Abstract. The recent work of Gatys et al., who characterized the style of an image by the statistics of convolutional neural network filters, ignited a renewed interest in the texture generation and image stylization problems. While their image generation technique uses a slow optimization process, recently several authors have proposed to learn generator neural networks that can produce similar outputs in one quick forward pass. While generator networks are promising, they are still inferior in visual quality and diversity compared to generation-by-optimization. In this work, we advance them in two significant ways. First, we introduce an instance normalization module to replace batch normalization with significant improvements to the quality of image stylization. Second, we improve diversity by introducing a new learning formulation that encourages generators to sample unbiasedly from the Julesz texture ensemble, which is the equivalence class of all images characterized by certain filter responses. Together, these two improvements take feed forward texture synthesis and image stylization much closer to the quality of generation-via-optimization, while retaining the speed advantage.

rows.title_medium: New paper: "Variational Dropout Sparsifies Deep Neural Networks"
rows.title_medium_rus: Новая публикация: "Variational Dropout Sparsifies Deep Neural Networks"
rows.title: New paper "Variational Dropout Sparsifies Deep Neural Networks"
rows.title_rus: Новая публикация "Variational Dropout Sparsifies Deep Neural Networks"
rows.description: Dmitry Verov and Dmitry Molchanov finilized new publication "Variational Dropout Sparsifies Deep Neural Networks". In this work variational Dropout technique was applied for parameter number reduction in fully-connected and convolutional layers in neural networks.
rows.description_rus: Дмитрий Ветров и Дмитрий Молчанов опубликовали новую статью "Variational Dropout Sparsifies Deep Neural Networks". В данной работе был развит новейший метод вариационного дропаута, который позволил существенно уменьшить число параметров полносвязных и сверточных слоев нейронных сетей.
rows.description_sub: Abstract. We explore a recently proposed Variational Dropout technique that provided an elegant Bayesian interpretation to Gaussian Dropout. We extend Variational Dropout to the case when dropout rates are unbounded, propose a way to reduce the variance of the gradient estimator and report first experimental results with individual dropout rates per weight. Interestingly, it leads to extremely sparse solutions both in fully-connected and convolutional layers. This effect is similar to automatic relevance determination effect in empirical Bayes but has a number of advantages. We reduce the number of parameters up to 280 times on LeNet architectures and up to 68 times on VGG-like networks with a negligible decrease of accuracy.

rows.title: Agreement for Megagrant funding
rows.keywords: Minestry of education, Russia, science, grants, megagrant
rows.keywords_rus: Министерство образования, Россия, наука, гранты, мегагрант
rows.description: Agreement with the Ministry of Education and Science of the Russian Federation for Megagrant funding in 2017-2019 for the operation of the Laboratory is signed.

rows.title: The Laboratory begins recruitment: research/teaching positions and PhD Fellowships
rows.title_rus: Лаборатория начинает набор исследователей, преподавателей и аспирантов
rows.description: We opened several research positions for  various levels including assistant professors, postdoc and  PhD students. The Laboratory offers a unique research program and also PhD fellowship program, where PhD students can be co-supervised by two or even 3 advisors. Candidates are expected to take advantage of the opportunities offered by both very innovative research and to actively seek cross-group collaborations and in friendly and collaborative environment. The Skoltech also offers a wide range of activities like seminars, workshops, and summer schools, as well as the possibility to engage in organizing such events.
rows.description_sub:
We encourage applications from outstanding candidates with motivation and passion with academic backgrounds in Applied Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Scientific Computing, Engineering, and related fields, and a keen interest in doing basic research in areas like: Machine Learning, Neural Networks, Complex Systems, Machine Intelligence, including Machine Vision and Natural Language Understanding, (Bio-Inspired) Robotic Systems, Data-Driven Computational Analysis, Big Data Analytic and Artificial Intelligence.
We are looking forward to receiving your online application consisting of a complete CV (incl. a list of publications, talks, projects and awards, if any), experience in programming, a short mission statement (1-2 pages) outlining the research interests of the candidate, and scanned transcripts of certificates (bachelor’s degree, master’s , PhD degree, other degrees).
Good knowledge of Matlab and/or Python is required.
For further information please contact: Prof. Ivan Oseledets, Prof. Victor Lempitsky and/or Prof. Andrzej Cichocki. Apply now and take a unique opportunity!

rows.title: The first official seminar "Deep Learning and Tensor Networks"
rows.title_rus: Первый официальный семинар "Глубокое обучение и тензорные сети"
rows.description:
The opening seminar under the guidance of Prof. Andrzej Cichocki was hold on Tuesday, May 2, at Skoltech.
The Schedule (by names of the speakers):
1. Andrzej Cichocki opening talk
2. Ivan Oseledets
3. Victor Lempitsky
4. Dmitry Vetrov
And then self-introduction session.
rows.description_rus:
Семинар-открытие под руководством проф. Анджея Чихоцкого прошел во вторник 2 мая в Сколтехе.
Выступления:
1. Анджей Чихоцкий, открытие семинара
2. Иван Оселедец
3. Виктор Лемпицкий
4. Дмитрий Ветров
И далее открытые обсуждения

rows.title_medium: New paper: "Riemannian Optimization for Skip-Gram Negative Sampling"
rows.title_medium_rus: Новая публикация: "Riemannian Optimization for Skip-Gram Negative Sampling"
rows.title: New paper "Riemannian Optimization for Skip-Gram Negative Sampling"
rows.title_rus: Новая публикация "Riemannian Optimization for Skip-Gram Negative Sampling"
rows.description: Ivan Oseledets finilized new publication "Riemannian Optimization for Skip-Gram Negative Sampling". In this work the new approach, based on low rank tensor approximations, is proposed for optimization of word embedding models learning. The work is performed under MegaGrant support.
rows.description_rus: Иван Оселедец с соавторами опубликовал новую статью "Riemannian Optimization for Skip-Gram Negative Sampling". В работе рассмотрены перспективы применения малоранговых тензорных аппроксимаций к задаче векторного представления слов (word embedding model). Работа выполнялась при поддержке МегаГрантом.
rows.description_sub: Abstract. Skip-Gram Negative Sampling (SGNS) word embedding model, well known by its implementation in “word2vec” software, is usually optimized by stochastic gradient descent. However, the optimization of SGNS objective can be viewed as a problem of searching for a good matrix with the low-rank constraint. The most standard way to solve this type of problems is to apply Riemannian optimization framework to optimize the SGNS objective over the manifold of required low-rank matrices. In this paper, we propose an algorithm that optimizes SGNS objective using Riemannian optimization and demonstrates its superiority over popular competitors, such as the original method to train SGNS and SVD over SPPMI matrix.

rows.title_medium: New book "Tensor Networks for Dimensionality Reduction and Large-scale Optimization: Part 2 Applications and Future Perspectives" is published
rows.title_medium_rus: Опубликована новая книга: "Tensor Networks for Dimensionality Reduction and Large-scale Optimization: Part 2 Applications and Future Perspectives"
rows.title: New book "Tensor Networks for Dimensionality Reduction and Large-scale Optimization: Part 2 Applications and Future Perspectives"
rows.title_rus: Новая книга Tensor Networks for Dimensionality Reduction and Large-scale Optimization: Part 2 Applications and Future Perspectives"
rows.description: Doct. Andrzej Cichocki and Doct. Ivan Oseledets finalized the second part of the book about modern tensor networks and deep learning techniques: "Tensor Networks for Dimensionality Reduction and Large-scale Optimization: Part 2 Applications and Future Perspectives".
rows.description_rus: Проф. Анджей Чихоцкий и проф. Иван Оселедец завершили подготовку второй части книги "Tensor Networks for Dimensionality Reduction and Large-scale Optimization: Part 2 Applications and Future Perspectives", посвященной практическим применениям новейших методов в области тензорных сетей и глубокого обучения.
rows.description_sub: Abstract. Part 2 of this monograph builds on the introduction to tensor networks and their operations presented in Part 1. It focuses on tensor network models for super-compressed higher-order representation of data/parameters and related cost functions, while providing an outline of their applications in machine learning and data analytics. A particular emphasis is on the tensor train (TT) and Hierarchical Tucker (HT) decompositions, and their physically meaningful interpretations which reflect the scalability of the tensor network approach. Through a graphical approach, we also elucidate how, by virtue of the underlying low-rank tensor approximations and sophisticated contractions of core tensors, tensor networks have the ability to perform distributed computations on otherwise prohibitively large volumes of data/parameters, thereby alleviating or even eliminating the curse of dimensionality. The usefulness of this concept is illustrated over a number of applied areas, including generalized regression and classification (support tensor machines, canonical correlation analysis, higher order partial least squares), generalized eigenvalue decomposition, Riemannian optimization, and in the optimization of deep neural networks. Part 1 and Part 2 of this work can be used either as stand-alone separate texts, or indeed as a conjoint comprehensive review of the exciting field of low-rank tensor networks and tensor decompositions.

rows.title_medium: New paper: "A New Generation of Brain-Computer Interfaces Driven by Discovery of Latent EEG-fMRI Linkages using Tensor Decomposition"
rows.title_medium_rus: Новая публикация: "A New Generation of Brain-Computer Interfaces Driven by Discovery of Latent EEG-fMRI Linkages using Tensor Decomposition"
rows.title: New paper "A New Generation of Brain-Computer Interfaces Driven by Discovery of Latent EEG-fMRI Linkages using Tensor Decomposition"
rows.title_rus: Новая публикация "A New Generation of Brain-Computer Interfaces Driven by Discovery of Latent EEG-fMRI Linkages using Tensor Decomposition"
rows.description: Doct. Andrzej Cichocki finilized new publication "A New Generation of Brain-Computer Interfaces Driven by Discovery of Latent EEG-fMRI Linkages using Tensor Decomposition". The work is performed under MegaGrant support.
rows.description_rus: Проф. Анджей Чихоцкий с соавторами опубликовал новую статью "A New Generation of Brain-Computer Interfaces Driven by Discovery of Latent EEG-fMRI Linkages using Tensor Decomposition". Работа выполнялась при поддержке МегаГрантом.
rows.description_sub: Abstract. A Brain-Computer Interface (BCI) is a setup permitting the control of external devices by decoding brain activity. Electroencephalography (EEG) has been extensively used for decoding brain activity since it is non-invasive, cheap, portable, and has high temporal resolution to allow real-time operation. Due to its poor spatial specificity, BCIs based on EEG can require extensive training and multiple trials to decode brain activity (consequently slowing down the operation of the BCI). On the other hand, BCIs based on functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) are more accurate owing to its superior spatial resolution and sensitivity to underlying neuronal processes which are functionally localized. However, due to its relatively low temporal resolution, high cost, and lack of portability, fMRI is unlikely to be used for routine BCI. We propose a new approach for transferring the capabilities of fMRI to EEG, which includes simultaneous EEG/fMRI sessions for finding a mapping from EEG to fMRI, followed by a BCI run from only EEG data, but driven by fMRI-like features obtained from the mapping identified previously. Our novel data-driven method is likely to discover latent linkages between electrical and hemodynamic signatures of neural activity hitherto unexplored using model-driven methods, and is likely to serve as a template for a novel multi-modal strategy wherein cross-modal EEG-fMRI interactions are exploited for the operation of a unimodal EEG system, leading to a new generation of EEG-based BCIs.
